result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dathien D Smith

records.addlTxt:
received and filed:
 proof of community service

Firearm Safety Certificate

Defendant Dathien D Smith in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Dathien D Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Final Review Hearing by Zoom, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 9.20.22

Defendant Dathien D Smith in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement. State informed the Court that defendant completed a CCW course.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dathien D Smith in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
State advises the Court this case is in DPA posture. Defense requests an adjournment to allow defendant time to complete a TAD evaluation. 
Court orders matter adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br. 37.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dathien D Smith in court.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Called customer service and told them that he was out of town on 4/22/2022. They called the court and case is rescheduled to 4/20/2022, at 1:00 p.m. He was notified of the new court date.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/22/2022@01:30pm
